title: add missing import for lr_scheduler
body_html: Currently, using the lr_scheduler by calling torch.optim.ReduceLROnPlateau as shown in the documentation returns module 'torch.optim' has no attribute 'ReduceLROnPlateau'. My guess is that this is because it's not imported in optim __init__.py. I have imported it in a similar fashion to how the optimizers are imported into __init__.py
body_text: Currently, using the lr_scheduler by calling torch.optim.ReduceLROnPlateau as shown in the documentation returns module 'torch.optim' has no attribute 'ReduceLROnPlateau'. My guess is that this is because it's not imported in optim __init__.py. I have imported it in a similar fashion to how the optimizers are imported into __init__.py
body: Currently, using the lr_scheduler by calling `torch.optim.ReduceLROnPlateau` as shown in the [documentation](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/optim.html#how-to-adjust-learning-rate) returns `module 'torch.optim' has no attribute 'ReduceLROnPlateau'`. My guess is that this is because it's not imported in `optim` `__init__.py`. I have imported it in a similar fashion to how the optimizers are imported into `__init__.py`
